p: The MIC was read as follows: E. coli, P. aeruginosa, S. aureus, and S. epidermidis after 18 h of incubation; yeasts after 48 h of incubation and M. smegmatis after 72 h of incubation. The MIC was defined as the lowest concentration of antimicrobial agent that completely inhibits growth of the organism in the microtitration plateâ€™s wells detected by the unaided eye. The assay was performed in triplicate.
